channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023080624
item.description:
Report X-2023080624

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-02
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023080624 SequenceEvent: Package was found with wet sides and obvious signs of internal leakage. QA was called and package was picked up. Package was put into a lined tote. DescribePack: Caps came loose during transit causing internal leakage. This is a constant problem with this product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened and package was kept in and upright position to prevent further leakage. 2. X-2023080625 SequenceEvent: Package was found with wet side and obvious signs of internal leakage. QA was called and package was picked up. Package was put into a lined tote. DescribePack: Caps came loose during transit causing internal leakage. This is a very common occurrence with this product. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Caps were tightened and package was kept in an upright position.

item.title: Report X-2023080393
item.description:
Report X-2023080393

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-14
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 14th, during the PM sort the package was discovered to be damaged and the inner contents could be observed. The contents were 20 small cylinders of refrigerant gas, each having a 2.2 label on the outside. There were no marks or labels on the outside package indicating the contents were dangerous goods. After reaching out to the shipper and manufacturer a Safety Data Sheet could not be located. UN1956 Compressed Gas, n.o.s. 2.2 was selected for the purposes of this report. If the SDS is provided by the shipper or manufacturer an updated 5800 will be provided. The shipment is being held pending disposition.

item.title: Report E-2023070957
item.description:
Report E-2023070957

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: RUSSELL
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/25/2023, at approximately 1650 hours, personnel in the CSX Russell, KY Yard reported a suspect Non-Accident Release involving PROX17502, a loaded tank car ofUN1830, Sulfuric Acid- reported to have product leaking from the top. The car was isolated and the shipper, Norflaco Sales Glencore Canada, was notified via CHEMTREC (report #2023-07-25-00337). Quick Response, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the vapor line valve in the fully open position and the secondary closure plug not installed. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- Marie-France Rollin (1-450-567-2026, Marie-France.Rollin@glencore.ca). Contractor personnel closed the valve with the valve handle and installed the secondary closure plug tool tight. Contractor personnel then performed neutralization and decontamination of the impacted surfaces on the exterior top and sides of the tank car. The car was placed on hold in the yard pending final inspection by CSX Hazmat personnel. On 7/27/23 PROX17502 was inspected by CSX personnel and released for transportation.

item.title: Report E-2023080330
item.description:
Report E-2023080330

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-28T18:15:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 27, 2023, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN1866 (resin solution) experienced a loose lid and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted tote and trailer and swept them in using hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum that RLC personnel took possession of to add to the facility waste stream

item.title: Report X-2023061741
item.description:
Report X-2023061741

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A DECLARED LEAKING HAZARDOUS MATERIALS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED UN3082 ENVIRONMENTALLY HAZARDOUS SUBSTANCE, LIQUID, N.O.S. WITH AN IATA DECLARATION. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. OVERPACK USED INDICATED ON THE DECLARATION AND BOX. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FOUR X ONE GALLON JUGS OF LOHFOAM 10 DEFOAMER INSIDE THE FIBERBOARD NON-SPECIFICATION OUTER BOX WITH ONE JUG LEAKING FROM THE CLOSURE OF THE JUG. THE DANGEROUS GOODS WERE NOT IN AN OVERPACK.
